column4: ok new problem here, anyone ever had to drag files of a NTFS windows OS, i am cd'd into the directory, and i see Documents and Settings
I cd into Documents and Settings and do a dir, and i see nothing
what's up with that
If you're using Vista, you'll need to cd into Users, not Documents and Settings
yes it is a vista install, ill try that
i copied my documents folder to a directory in my ~ .... but none of the pictures copied over and i know there are pictures there in the My Pictures
mabye not... lol
again, you got the wrong folder. Vista puts a bunch of (it's equivalent of) symbolic links in a bunch of folders. You probably want c:\Users\Username\Documents
there's also a Pictures folder in the same place as Documents. They might be there.
i went to c:\users\username\documents
im going to go boot into vista and check see where the files are actually at >.>
good plan ;)
ok so the files are actually in username/Pictures ....

The first says whether or not filesystems need to be dumped, and is usually 0 these days. The second says whether (and in what order) to check filesystems during bootup, and should be 1 for internal Linux partitions.
how come i can see /home in my /dev/sda4 and i dont know of ever creating a symbolic link
I'm not sure what you're asking...
ok, i just mounted /dev/sda4, i go to the directory it is mounted in, and i can see $username, and home and lost+found, why
I assume because you either created a separate /home/ partition at some point, or put the folders there...
... i just mounted it...
this is the first time this has ever been mounted i didnt put anything there
hrm, that's odd then. lost+found is supposed to be there (it's supposed to be on all ext2/3/4 partitions), but home isn't... Is there anything in there, or is it just an empty directory?
home is empty
